intro: Frangula grisea, commonly known as gray frangula, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rutaceae. It is native to the western United States and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant produces small, dark blue berries that are often used in traditional medicine. Frangula grisea is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient shrub in desert ecosystems. Its bark and leaves contain compounds that have been studied for potential medicinal properties.
